createCustomTermsInvestment(address,uint.details: For offchain payments, pre-negotiated deals      Works with any token type USE CASES: - SAFE with custom valuation cap for lead investor - Options with custom vesting schedule for employees - Convertible notes with custom interest rates - Wire/ACH payments tracked offchain

params.encodedCustomTerms: Encoded terms (format depends on token type)

getCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256).details: Called by OfferingCoreFacet during token issuance

hasCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256).details: Called by OfferingCoreFacet to determine if custom terms should be applied

returns.hasTerms: True if custom terms are set
True if pre-approved terms are set

packedSelectors().details: Each selector is 4 bytes, packed sequentially with no padding      MUST NOT include packedSelectors() itself in the returned selectors      MUST be a pure function (no state access)

setCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256,byte.details: Called by OfferingCoreFacet when applying pre-approved terms      This is the ONLY way to set terms after investment is created

setPreApprovedTermsForInvestor(address,b.details: Investor can then invest themselves and terms will be automatically applied      This supports the "pull" model where investor initiates but with negotiated terms USE CASES: - Lead investor negotiates custom SAFE terms, then invests via UI - Employee receives custom option terms, then exercises via portal - Investor gets custom discount, then participates in offering

params.encodedTerms: Encoded terms (format depends on token type)

clearPreApprovedTermsForInvestor(address.notice: Clear pre-approved terms for an investor

createCustomTermsInvestment(address,uint.notice: Create admin-initiated investment with custom terms

getCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256).notice: Get custom terms for an investment (internal use)

getPreApprovedTermsForInvestor(address).notice: Get pre-approved terms for an investor

hasCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256).notice: Check if investment has custom terms (internal use)

hasPreApprovedTermsForInvestor(address).notice: Check if investor has pre-approved terms

packedSelectors().notice: Returns all function selectors for this facet as tightly packed bytes

setCustomTermsForInvestment(uint256,byte.notice: Set custom terms for an investment (internal use only)

setPreApprovedTermsForInvestor(address,b.notice: Set pre-approved custom terms for an investor
